reviews.review_msg: She is one of the worst. Very Sarcastic and try not to take class from her
She is very sarcastic and doesn't care about her students. Do not take this course with her

Straight shooter. Very clear what she wants. You get what you put in. However, the assignments can be very tedious and time-consuming even though they are not worth much. Exams are exactly like practice questions, and her lectures are full of many hints.
The course was pretty easy.  Very little homework and the exams were straight from the course notes.  I skipped several lectures but did just fine.

Good prof! The course material isn't particularly exciting, but Lorene makes it meaningful and practical. She's passionate about the subject and is approachable for help. The midterm was a challenge but it's still fair; you'll have to work for the grade, and make sure you attend lectures.

I like her as a prof because she's very clear on what she wants and you literally just need to study the notes she gives. ALL her questions are based off her notes so make sure you attend class. First half of the class is more difficult so pay more attention. Second half is easy because she gives you one specific way to do each type of question.

One of the tougher courses I have done. Not many assignments and a low work load, gives lots of practice questions which are essential to doing well. Have to put a lot more work into this course than others. Assignments are worth little compared to the work put into them. Tests were challenging, need to study lots. I enjoyed the content though.

I loved Lorene's class. Her notes were fill in the blank with so many types of examples. She gave hints to what questions were on exams and as the term went along I enjoyed the material. She is very straight up so I understand how some people can be intimidated. Speak with her in person for feedback. I left this course having learned a lot.
She is condescending and a poor lecturer. Textbook is practically useless. The final is tough! Make sure to practice lecture problems and weekly problem sets to prepare for final.
great professor like her lectureno need text book. morepractice higher grade you will get

She has good notes, but exams are pretty tough. Do all the practice questions (I mean ALL of them) and you'll have a chance at a half-decent mark. Long exams (95% of students stayed until the end of the exams). Textbook can be confusing at times. Practice is key.

She provides you with great notes to study, you don't need the textbook at all. She can be funny BUT really unapproachable, since she maintains a negative attitude towards students. Also she tries to make the material seem harder than it is. Her exams are unfair since they're mostly multiple choice, which is not suitable for a math-based course.
Classes were really boring and her examples were somewhat clear but she has great notes.

I have not ever seen such a careless, casual, rude professior ever, she is not careful with her lecture notes, almost every lecture we can find some mistakes! In other words, she is not interested in teaching and not responsible for her students.Even though she is organized, but still not patient and being lazy when you go to her office hour.

Loved this class despite the early mornings. Lorene teaches statistics in a way that makes you understand it. There is a lot of material, but just KEEP UP with the problem sets and use that open labs! Then you can get a good grade no problem.
